intro: Banisteriopsis cornifolia var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic-stemmed bignon, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
